intro: Crocodilodes oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved crocodilodes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
